‚Å£Join the challenge that changes lives! Just 15-days until the Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts on Jan 13th, 2020. Places strictly limited! Secure your spot now click the link in bio üì≤ .
ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄ Eating 'healthy' but not losing weight?
.
üîç Lets turn super sleuth, go detective on types of food, portion sizes and eating habits. .
The three most common causes of someone's confusion at a lack of results is usually:
.
ü•ë 1) Eats big portions of 'healthy' foods not considering amount of calories. Doesn't matter if it's labelled as 'healthy' if it's calorific and you're consuming loads of it, you're going to gain weight.
.
üìÜ 2) You're a weekend warrior. When the weekend comes you play hard and consume a week's worth of calories over the two day period. Total up what a weekend costs you in calories and realise that this is costing you your results. However it is important to note that we encourage living your life, so we'll help you make simple swaps and plan ahead so you can still have a social life.
.
‚òï 3) You eat healthy but you're not realising the impact of other calorie containing scoundrels like drinks and sweets. I'm writing this from Costa (that's a coffee shop in the UK for our international fans) and the seasonal Black Forest hot chocolate is a whopping 525 calories a cup! Imagine knocking back one of those a day and not tracking it. The same goes for sugar and milk in cups of tea or coffee. If you're making one an hour at work, that's soon going to stack up.
.
ü§î So next time you scratch your head and wonder why you're not getting results despite calling your way of eating 'healthy' have a good look into everything you're eating and drinking. Could one of these common pitfalls be the problem?
.
The next Body Smart Fitness 28 Day Challenge starts Monday Jan 13, 2020. Click the link in bio to secure your place. üì≤
.
#weightloss #weightlossjourney #weightlosstransformations #weightlosshelp #weightlosstips #healthy #healthy #food #foodtracking #myfitnesspal #weekendwarrior #calories #caloriedeficit #fat2fit #fat

‚Å£Join the challenge that changes lives! 16 days until the Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts on Jan 13, 2020. Places strictly limited! Secure your spot now click the link in bio üì≤ üóì Rachel first started with Body Smart in January 2019 saying she "looked like a barrel". She joined the 28 Day Challenge figuring she had nothing to lose and only new information and knowledge to gain.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ Within 28 days, Rachel was starting to work on forging some new habits and soaked up all the educational side of the 28-day programme. For the first time in years she could see how the diet industry had never properly explained that all diets work - as long as there is a calorie deficit.‚Å£
‚Å£
üòÑ "I'd been told by a well known slimming brand that I could eat as many potatoes or as much pasta as I wanted on certain days and I can now look back and see how wrong that is. It's a maths game. Calories in vs calories out. Once I understood that I could take control of my own eating." said Rachel.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí™ Rachel graduated from the 28 Day Challenge and decided to carry on her journey, moving into 1:1 coaching with Jaymie.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ Rachel loved the support she received from Jaymie and all the coaches saying "People often question me about online coaching but I actually think because we aren't face to face, I am more honest. I open up to Jaymie and tell him things I don't tell other people. Not just my diet and fitness but my personal life too and he is always there to help me make sense of it and coach me through any struggles."‚Å£
‚Å£
üëô One big win for Rachel was wearing a bikini on a girl's holiday for the first time in her life. This has been such a big worry and source of anxiety to Rachel but once she started seeing results, her confidence soared and she wore her bikini on the beach with pride.‚Å£
‚Å£
üè• Rachel also went through unexpected emergency surgery midway through her first year of coaching with us. Jaymie was there to help her through her recovery and Rachel said "He wouldn't let me train, made me listen to the doctors and made me focus on my diet instead. Those two weeks after surgery I lost more weight than the previous month!".‚Å£
.
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£

‚Å£Join the challenge that changes lives! 16 days until the Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts on Jan 13, 2020. Places strictly limited! Secure your spot now click the link in bio üì≤ üôã‚Äç‚ôÄ Hands up if you're in a regular exercise routine and this happens for you?‚Å£
‚Å£
üêª I know when I don't workout I am like a grizzly bear with a sore head. My mood is in the pits, I'm irritable and snappy and the anxiety levels can soar quite quickly.‚Å£
‚Å£
üòÑI love what exercise does to help me stay in shape but the best part is how it quietens my mind, reduces stress, increases happy thoughts, makes me think clearer and helps me believe in myself.‚Å£
‚Å£
üìâ Most people come to Body Smart with a goal rooted in fat loss. What they go on to achieve is ALWAYS more than that though. It changes your attitude and mood and helps you create a whole new identity for yourself.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ You never know what you're capable of until you try.‚Å£
‚Å£
üôå If you think you've tried everything but haven't tried Body Smart then you're in for a treat. There is no online coaching company like us who is able to give such personal service for the level of investment.‚Å£
‚Å£
We create every plan and strategy around you and your lifestyle. We tweak it and change it as you build new positive habits and create your new identity.‚Å£
‚Å£
üóì You don't have to wait until January to get the ball rolling. You can factor the holiday period into your coaching journey with us - even at this late stage in December.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ We have a couple of slots for breakthrough calls left over the next few days before we break for the holidays. See if you're a good fit for us and we are a good fit for you. DM me and I'll help you set up a call.‚Å£
‚Å£
#quote #motivationalquote #motivation #exercise #mind #body #attitude #mindset #fitness #stress #workout #training #exercising #homeworkout #fitness #cardio

üôã‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è 28-Day Challenge üôåEARLY BIRD OFFER NOW ON!
.
Comment below - #CutTheBS to secure your spot.
.
üôã‚Äç‚ôÄIncredible opportunity for COMMITTED women!
.
Get ready to take part in a body and mindset challenge like no other?
.
The Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts MONDAY Jan 13, 2020 and we are looking for a powerhouse of unstoppable positive women all striving to reach the same goals‚Ä¶ TOGETHER! üôå
.
Are you ready and committed to:
‚úÖ Complete 3 effective, energising workouts per week to sculpt your body, see results and feel great in your own skin.
‚úÖ Work with your own REAL PERSON Body Smart coach on a 1-to-1 basis. We‚Äôll deliver proven Nutrition, Exercise and Mindset Coaching to overcome struggles and accelerate wins.
‚úÖ Learn a foolproof ‚Äúso-easy-a-toddler-could-do-it‚Äù strategy to enjoy all the foods you love. Seriously - no food is off limits! Yes you can still hit the Ô¨Åzz or the gin at the weekend (life is for living remember!)
‚úÖ Be willing to support the other ladies on the same journey as you and want to have FUN
‚úÖ Be OPEN to new concepts and ways of thinking in order to get REAL results
.
How freakin' exciting does that sound?!
.
Stop spinning all the plates, start getting results, get in control of your diet and fitness and be supported every step of the way. You‚Äôll be amazed at how awesome you can feel in just a month üìÜ
.
‚òùOur powerful Body Smart blueprint liberates women from the diet trap by focusing on mindset, self-love and learning the right strategy for you and your lifestyle. You get access to all of this and more on the 28 Day Challenge.
.
Ready to make a lasting change? üôã‚Äç‚ôÄ
.

‚Å£Join the challenge that changes lives! 17 days until the Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts on Jan 13, 2020. Places strictly limited! Secure your spot now click the link in bio üì≤ üóì It's all about the long game. I don't know how many times I can stress this.‚Å£
‚Å£
‚ùå Stop overthinking it.‚Å£
‚ùå Stop replacing food with supplements.‚Å£
‚ùå Stop with the quick-fix mentality.‚Å£
‚Å£
üòÅ If you focus on the basics of sleep, sustainable exercise, eating in a calorie deficit and drinking water you will notice huge changes in a year.‚Å£
‚Å£
It's better to take small steps and lose a little every week than continue to live in the frustrating cycle of being 'on' and 'off' the wagon and really never making any real progress.‚Å£
‚Å£
The thing about this time next year.‚Å£
‚Å£
ü§î How do you want to feel?‚Å£
‚Å£
üìÜ If you've got a weight loss target, a whole year is a fantastic time frame to make changes to your habits slowly and steadily. This time next year you won't even look like the same person, think like the same person or behave like the same person.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ So if you're ready to do it slowly and consistently you'll build the habits needed to sustain it for life.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ We're back from our Christmas break on Monday but the doors to register for our next 28 Day Challenge are OPEN. The next challenge starts on Mon, Jan 13, 2020. Join a like-minded community of winning ladies all forging new habits that you can sustain for a lifetime.

Places strictly limited! Secure your spot on the next challenge now. Click the link in bio üì≤ ‚Å£

‚Å£Join the challenge that changes lives! 19 days until the Body Smart 28 Day Challenge starts on 13/01/2020. Places strictly limited! Secure your spot now click the link in bio üì≤
.
üôè Gratitude is scientifically proven to help your well-being. Actively being grateful for what you have rather than being negative and resentful for what you don't have or being negative - particularly towards yourself can have a damaging effect on your mental health.
.
üëâ Only YOU is in charge of the way you think inside your own head. Only YOU can change that negative self-talk into something more appreciative and valuable.
.
üß† So next time you find yourself staring at your reflection and maybe getting frustrated at what you don't have, or being nasty and unkind towards yourself how about you reframe these thoughts?
.
ü§≥ In fact, can you put this phone down right now and look in the mirror and BE GRATEFUL for something about yourself? I know, it's a horrible and scary thought. But why is it so hard? It shouldn't be difficult to appreciate the one place you have to live - your body.
.
üí¨ Try it and let me know how you get on in the comments below. Could you do it? How did it feel?
.
Follow us @bodysmartfitness and don't forget to check out the 28 Day Challenge. Next round starts Jan 13th 2020. Click the link in the bio üì≤
.
#bodysmartfitness #gratitude #attitude #grateful #mentalhealth #health #mentality #fitness #transformation #weightlossjourney #fat2fit #gym #motivation

üëâ Contrary to popular belief, all diets work for fat loss if you're able to adhere and stay in a consistent calorie deficit.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
‚úã There is no right or wrong strategy - it is about finding what works for you and finding something you can adhere to until you achieve your goal.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
All the above 'diets' are simply strategies that are trying to get you to adhere to a calorie deficit which is the overall principle of fat loss.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
üí™ Make sure you pick a diet that you can see yourself doing in the future otherwise you're potentially laying a foundation that will not serve you in the future.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
ü•ë For example - following a keto diet and losing 30lbs is brilliant, but once you've achieved your goal are you really going to restrict carbs forever? If not, what happens when you reintroduce carbs? You will yo-yo. Meaning that will not serve you in the future. You've laid poor foundations that won't help in the long term. If you honestly CAN restrict carbs forever then knock yourself out - you've found the diet for you.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
üí¨ Have you found the diet that works for you? Let us know in the comments.‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£‚Å£

üéÑ It's the holidays! Time to change that mindset.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ There is literally no point stressing about something that *TRUTH BOMB ALERT* is completely within your control.‚Å£
‚Å£
Only you decides what you eat.‚Å£
‚Å£
Only you decides what you drink.‚Å£
‚Å£
Only you decides how you will move your body.‚Å£
‚Å£
üòÑ The holidays usually means time off work so get out there and get moving. Learn to say "No thank you" if you're really trying to stick to your eating goals. Or just learn strategies to pull back on calories around the festivities. Or just say "Fuck it" it's the holidays and enjoy yourself.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí™ Personally, we will be eating all the food, drinking all the drinks but making sure we get to the gym, get outside, drink water, probably fast until lunch and most importantly - not stress about it!‚Å£
‚Å£
üóì One week out of 52 isn't going to ruin your life. Have fun, it's the holidays!‚Å£
‚Å£
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£
To sign up for personalised online coaching, click the link in bio üì≤‚Å£‚Å£
‚Å£
#holidays #christmas #food #mindset #diet #dieting #calories #macros #protein #carbs #fat #exercise #workout #dietpan #dieting #xmas #healthy

üëâ "Everything in moderation" is that phrase that EVERYONE knows. It's so obvious but we don't listen to it, we continue to restrict and put ourselves in the danger zone for bingeing.‚Å£
‚Å£
ü§§ When you have a craving for a certain food but you continue to tell yourself it is banned and restricted, that craving just builds and builds.‚Å£
‚Å£
üò± What usually happens? You restrict for so long and then something snaps and before you know it you're eating double the amount you would've done if you'd just allowed it in moderation.‚Å£
‚Å£
üçï At Body Smart, we coach our clients to understand why NO FOOD is banned and off limits. You effectively choose your diet. You are in control. We just teach you a foolproof strategy steeped in science that will enable you to enjoy all the foods you love - in moderation!‚Å£
‚Å£
üîë Moderation is definitely the key. We all know it. We show you how to easily adopt it into your own daily diet for total food freedom.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ If you're sick and tired of missing out on the foods you love and you'd like to develop a sense of food freedom then get in touch. Let's see if coaching with Body Smart is right for you and you are right for us.‚Å£
‚Å£
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£
‚Å£
To sign up for personalised online coaching, click the link in bio üì≤‚Å£
‚Å£
#macros #protein #carbs #fat #iifym #flexiblediet #flexibledieting #diet #dieting #calorie #caloriedeficit #cleaneating #restriction #bingeing #bingeeating

‚åö We make the time for things that are important to us.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ If you've got a minute to spare, we've got time to listen to what your ideal best life looks like and tell you how we can help support you to achieve your goals.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ It's not just diet and exercise it's mindset and habit. That starts with making time for yourself and prioritising YOU.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëä You are the most important thing in your world. Not work. Not your spouse. Not your kids even. YOU. Without you functioning at your best, there is no you.‚Å£
‚Å£
üì≤ Five minutes, you and me. You up for chatting? Send me a DM and I'll get back to you.‚Å£
‚Å£
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£‚Å£

üéÑ It's just one day - and it doesn't need to derail your progress.‚Å£
‚Å£
üéÅ We encourage all of our clients to enjoy Christmas. We believe taking the restriction element away changes something in your mindset when it comes to holiday eating habits.‚Å£
‚Å£
You can have whatever you want at Christmas, but if you want to feel great over the festive period here's our tips for staying on track:‚Å£
‚Å£
1‚É£ Keep hydrated. Not only will plenty of fresh water keep you hydrated but it works to keep cravings at bay.‚Å£
‚Å£
2‚É£ Stay active. You're off work! No excuse not to move your body. Long winter walks, playing out with the kids and their new toys, getting a run or a home workout session is easy. These days you can even just put '30/45/60 min workout' into YouTube and be guided through a quick workout you can do by the Christmas tree in front of the TV!‚Å£
‚Å£
3‚É£ You don't have to eat everything in sight. Sometimes it's easier to just say "No thanks" than dig in. Before you know it, you've inhaled a wheel of brie and snaffled another box of chocolates. Do you really need them? Are they going to make you feel good?‚Å£
‚Å£
4‚É£ Don't eat for the sake of it. Seeing all that food everywhere does make our eyes bigger than our bellies. If you need to, close your eyes, take a deep breath and ask "am I really hungry?" ‚Å£
‚Å£
5‚É£ You could make some healthy swaps this festive season. Go in for the veg first! The greener the better! Then the meat and finally all the other stuff. Load up on fresh veggies and meat to fill you up.‚Å£
‚Å£
6‚É£ Enjoy yourself! It's Christmas! Don't stress about it too much. Everything is in your control. Everything you put in your mouth is your decision and every way you move your body is your choice too. Crank up the Christmas tunes and have a family party. You'll have fun and crank the steps up at the same time.‚Å£
‚Å£
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness‚Å£
‚Å£
To sign up for personalised online coaching, click the link in bio üì≤‚Å£
‚Å£
#christmas #xmas #holidays #christmasfitnesstips #fitnesstips #stayontrack #hydration #christmasdinner #christmasfood #holidaysfood #dieting #diet #calorie #calories #active #keepfit

ü§î Do you label foods as good and bad?
.
üß† Do you know the effect of language on your brain?
.
üòí Labelling foods as bad creates a really unhealthy relationship with food. In our experience, restriction leads to rebellion which leads to bingeing and then feeling like a failure.
.
üôã‚Äç‚ôÄ Want to know a way to stop that?
.
üòÑ Stop labelling foods as good and bad. Simple! It's just food. Enjoy a bit of what you love and learn how to keep it in balance.
.
üí¨ If you're sick of thinking you can't eat this and you can't eat that and you just want to stop the cycle then get in touch. We will teach you our mind blowingly simple system of tracking food and keeping everything in balance.
.
üçï Want pizza? We'll show you how to enjoy every slice and make it fit to your life. No guilt. No labels. Just food.
.
üì≤ Get in touch to arrange a call with a Body Smart coach.
.
Follow us - @bodysmartfitness
.
To sign up for personalised online coaching, click the link in bio üì≤
.

üì≤ We have cultivated a community of women who truly lift each other up and offer the most amazing support. Our VIP social groups see our female community be there for one another in so many ways. It is yet another part of what makes us different and how we provide a service above and beyond.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ Would you like results and an experience like Rachel? Get in touch this week and we can arrange a breakthrough call with a Body Smart Coach. We will chat about you, your life and your goals. See if we are a right fit for you, and you're a right fit for us.‚Å£

üëâ Let's be honest - we all know this one don't we? It's the visual we learn as kids about energy balance.‚Å£
‚Å£
‚úã We all know we need to fuel ourselves adequately yet many people will think they can run on fumes! You can't!‚Å£
‚Å£
ü•ó Also when it comes to fuelling our bodies we have a choice on the quality of that fuel we put in. While we don't label any foods as good or bad, you know yourself that when you prioritise high quality, nutritionally dense whole foods that you feel and 'run' a lot better.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí™ If you eat the right foods for your training not only will you reduce body fat and increase lean muscle but you'll improve your strength levels and your mental focus.‚Å£
‚Å£
üöÄ So make sure you're fuelling yourself properly. It will be the difference of speeding to the finish line of your goals or chugging along and never really getting anywhere.‚Å£
‚Å£

üëâ Firstly, let me start by reassuring you that you aren't in the wrong or stupid (as I have sadly seen some other online coaches call out on posts like these). ‚Å£
‚Å£
Some people genuinely believe that they are in a calorie deficit and not losing weight. They believe they are the anomaly and something must be wrong with them or their metabolism.‚Å£
‚Å£
üìâ Let me assure you that even those with thyroid challenges still lose weight when in a calorie deficit. I work with clients who are on thyroid medication and we tweak their calorie intake and deficit accordingly.‚Å£
‚Å£
So what might cause you to believe you're in a calorie deficit but the truth is you aren't?‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ You worked out your calories wrong‚Å£
‚Å£
People usually put their output as too high and their input too low compared to what actually happens. Make sure when working out your calories to be in a deficit that you have been honest about your average daily activity levels.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ Not tracking accurately‚Å£
‚Å£
Tracking calories is a fine art and until you are proficient in eyeballing your food and tracking without weighing (usually around 18 months - 2 years into your tracking journey) then you really should weigh everything to get accurate on your daily calorie intake. You also need to watch when tracking using MyFitnessPal. Because it is a community led database there are a LOT of errors. Check, check and double check.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ You're relying on a fitness watch‚Å£
‚Å£
Fitness watches are amazing for motivation but don't rely on them for accurate calorie counting. Experts believe they are out by as much as 40%. They can lull you into a false sense of security if you're allowing yourself more calories against what your watch says you have burned during the day.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ You can't deny science or the laws of thermodynamics so if you believe you're in a deficit but still not losing weight, you will need to investigate and make adjustments. Need an expert to help with this? This is exactly what we do with our 1:1 coaching clients. So stop the stress and frustration and get the support you need.‚Å£
‚Å£

Training that needs to stop üõë ‚Å£
‚Å£
1‚É£ Doing half or quarter reps - you need to use the full range of motion with each movement. You get less out of the exercise and you don't feel the burn. If you can't help doing half or quarter reps your technique might be off or you might be lifting too heavy. ‚Å£
‚Å£
2‚É£ Wearing running shoes on leg day - if you jumped on your mattress and did a squat you'd be all over the place stabilising your ankles, knees and hips. This is what is happening on a smaller scale when you wear big running shoes. Take your shoes off or get some lifting shoes.‚Å£
‚Å£
3‚É£ Training to failure on every set - if you hit failure on your first working set of your workout it is going to negatively impact the rest of your workout. Your chance of injury goes through the roof.‚Å£
‚Å£
4‚É£ Doing lots of cardio before resistance training - you are depleting your energy levels before lifting. This is counter productive, especially if your goal is to build muscle or get stronger.‚Å£
‚Å£
5‚É£ Doing isolation movements - this only isolates one muscle and pivots from one joint. Go for compound movements which use multiple muscles, sometimes 15+ muscles at once which will burn more calories compared to working one solo muscle.‚Å£
‚Å£
6‚É£ Forcing yourself into movements you're not mobile enough to do - One example might be doing a barbell back squat before they can even do a bodyweight squat with good form. This will only lead to injury. You have to be very careful and patient. Build up to these bigger exercises.‚Å£
‚Å£
üí¨ Got any questions about any of these? Drop me a message or add to the daily 'Ask me a question' on Insta stories and I'll try reply.‚Å£

ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÇ This is me. Every time there's an argument over which diet is best in the comments.‚Å£
‚Å£
Want to know the truth?‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ ALL DIETS WORK - depending on your goal.‚Å£
‚Å£
üëå The difference in what makes a diet "better" is its sustainability and the enjoyment factor. The best diet for you is the one that keeps you healthy and allows you to enjoy the foods you love. That will look different for every single person to some degree and why there is no one size fits all approach‚Å£
‚Å£
üëâ Remember - a diet is not a short term option. Once you choose to change the way you eat you really do need to stick to it for life or learn how to tweak it for maintaining your results.‚Å£
‚Å£
So before you think you can do a quick fix faddy diet that cuts out carbs or replaces food with shakes or has you taking magic pills you have to ask yourself the following questions:‚Å£
‚Å£
- Can I eat this way for the rest of my life?‚Å£
- Can I afford to eat this way/take this supplement for the rest of my life?‚Å£
- Does this diet support my overall health?‚Å£
- Can I resist all temptation to eat the 'banned' foods this diet says I can't have... forever?!‚Å£
- Is this diet definitely putting me in a calorie deficit?‚Å£
- Will I be able to tweak this diet once I reach my goal to maintain my results?‚Å£
‚Å£
üòÑ So here comes the marketing tactic (and our truth) at Body Smart we can honestly say, hand on heart, that the strategy we teach our clients when it comes to their diet can answer a confident YES to each one of those statements above. Apart from the one about banned foods. No foods are banned with Body Smart. Eat what you like. We teach you how you can.‚Å£
‚Å£
ü§î Can you do the same for your chosen 'diet'?‚Å£
‚Å£

üëâ We've had a few clients ask about iron recently so created this infographic to go in our extensive Learning Zone library that all clients have access to.‚Å£
‚Å£
üåç We thought it was a good public service to share this with you too! Low iron levels can lead to anemia which can be very unpleasant and debilitating for many people. 33% of the world's population are anemic with half of those people suffering with iron deficiency.‚Å£
‚Å£
üÜé Iron deficiency occurs when the body doesn't have enough of the mineral iron. This leads to abnormally low levels of red blood cells. That's because iron is needed to make hemoglobin, a protein in red blood cells that enables them to carry oxygen around the body.‚Å£
‚Å£
üò¥ Signs of iron deficiency include unusual tiredness, paleness, shortness of breath, headaches and dizziness, heart palpitations, dry and damaged hair and skin, swelling and soreness of the tongue and mouth, restless legs and brittle nails.‚Å£
‚Å£
üè• Women need more iron in their diet than men. According to the UK NHS guidelines, the recommended iron intake per day is 14.8mg a day for women aged 19 to 50. 8.7mg a day for women over 50.‚Å£
‚Å£
üë®‚Äç‚öï If you think you might be deficient in iron, you can always check with your doctor. These food lists are worth saving so you can quickly reference the best sources of iron for your diet.‚Å£
‚Å£
Any surprises in there?‚Å£
